abstract_summ: Methods: Open-access COVID-19 case data include 18,069 geo-located cases in China during January and February 2020, which were mapped onto a 0.25° latitude/longitude grid together with population and weather data (temperature, solar radiation and precipitation).Methods: Open-access COVID-19 case data include 18,069 geo-located cases in China during January and February 2020, which were mapped onto a 0.25° latitude/longitude grid together with population and weather data (temperature, solar radiation and precipitation).Methods: Publicly available COVID-19 cases and deaths data and weather data were analyzed at the metropolitan level.Weekly means of maximum daily temperature varied from -28.0 to 30.1 °C, minimum daily temperature from -42.4 to 23.0 °C, maximum solar radiation from 0.04 to 2.74 MJm-2 and total precipitation from 0 to 72.6 mm.Weekly means of maximum daily temperature varied from −28.0°C to 30.1°C, minimum daily temperature from −42.4°C to 23.0°C, maximum solar radiation from 0.04 to 2.74 MJm(−2) and total precipitation from 0 to 72.6 mm.
title_summ: Eco-epidemiological assessment of the COVID-19 epidemic in China, January-February 2020Climate affects global patterns of COVID-19 early outbreak dynamicsImpact of mitigating interventions and temperature on the instantaneous reproduction number in the COVID-19 epidemic among 30 US metropolitan areasCOVID-19 incidence trends between April and June 2020: A global analysisInfluence of Absolute Humidity and Population Density on COVID-19 Spread and Decay Durations: Multi-prefecture Study in JapanEffects of weather and policy intervention on COVID-19 infection in GhanaWill environmental changes in temperature affect the course of COVID-19?The role of climate during the COVID‐19 epidemic in New South Wales, AustraliaImpact of temperature on the dynamics of the COVID-19 outbreak in ChinaA Spatio‐Temporal Analysis of the Environmental Correlates of COVID‐19 Incidence in SpainEco-epidemiological assessment of the COVID-19 epidemic in China, January–February 2020
title_abstract_phrases: Methods: Open-access COVID-19 case data include 18,069 geo-located cases in China during January and February 2020, which were mapped onto a 0.25° latitude/longitude grid together with population and weather data (temperature, solar radiation and precipitation).Methods: Open-access COVID-19 case data include 18,069 geo-located cases in China during January and February 2020, which were mapped onto a 0.25° latitude/longitude grid together with population and weather data (temperature, solar radiation and precipitation).Weekly means of maximum daily temperature varied from -28.0 to 30.1 °C, minimum daily temperature from -42.4 to 23.0 °C, maximum solar radiation from 0.04 to 2.74 MJm-2 and total precipitation from 0 to 72.6 mm.Weekly means of maximum daily temperature varied from −28.0°C to 30.1°C, minimum daily temperature from −42.4°C to 23.0°C, maximum solar radiation from 0.04 to 2.74 MJm(−2) and total precipitation from 0 to 72.6 mm.This study investigates the effects of temperature, humidity, precipitation, wind speed and the specific government policy intervention of partial lockdown on the new cases of COVID-19 infection in Ghana.
